intro: Adesmia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its characteristic pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant is notable for its glandular structures, which are present on both the stems and leaves, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
